dd.description: Dump and die the variable outputting the data to the page

autoescape.description: Whether automatic escaping is enabled or not, you can mark a section of a template to be escaped or not by using the autoescape tag

block.description: When a template uses inheritance and if you want to print a block multiple times, use the block function

do.description: The do tag works exactly like the regular variable expression ({{ ... }}) just that it doesn't print anything

defined.description: Is defined is used for checks if a variable is defined in the current context.

embed.description: The embed tag combines the behaviour of include and extends. It allows you to include another template's contents, just like include does. But it also allows you to override any block defined inside the included template, like when extending a template

filter.description: Filter sections allow you to apply regular Twig filters on a block of template data. Just wrap the code in the special filter section

flush.description: The flush tag tells Twig to flush the output buffer

for.description: Loop over each item in a sequence

for if.description: Loop over each item in a sequence

for else.description: Loop over each item in a sequence

for if else.description: Loop over each item in a sequence

loop.description: special variables inside of a for loop block

if.description: The if statement in Twig is comparable with the if statements of PHP

if else.description: The if statement in Twig is comparable with the if statements of PHP

else.description: The if statement in Twig is comparable with the if statements of PHP

else if.description: The if statement in Twig is comparable with the if statements of PHP

import.description: Twig supports putting often used code into macros. These macros can go into different templates and get imported from there.

_self.description: To import macros from the current file, use the special _self variable for the source

include.description: The include statement includes a template and returns the rendered content of that file into the current namespace

sandbox.description: The sandbox tag can be used to enable the sandboxing mode for an included template, when sandboxing is not enabled globally for the Twig environment

set block.description: Inside code blocks you can also assign values to variables. Assignments use the set tag and can have multiple targets

spaceless.description: Use the spaceless tag to remove whitespace between HTML tags, not whitespace within HTML tags or whitespace in plain text

verbatim.description: The verbatim tag marks sections as being raw text that should not be parsed. For example to put Twig syntax as example into a template you can use this snippet

Symfony provides a specialized Twig tag.description: Symfony provides a specialized Twig tag trans to help with message translation of static blocks of text

attribute.description: The attribute function can be used to access a "dynamic" attribute of a variable

constant.description: constant returns the constant value for a given string

cycle.description: The cycle function cycles on an array of values

date function.description: Converts an argument to a date to allow date comparison

dump.description: (function) dumps information about a template variable. This is mostly useful to debug a template that does not behave as expected by introspecting its variables

include function.description: (function) returns the rendered content of a template

max.description: (function) returns the biggest value of a sequence or a set of values

min.description: (function) returns the lowest value of a sequence or a set of values

parent.description: (function)  return the content of the block as defined in the base template

random.description: (function) returns a random value depending on the supplied parameter type

range set.description: (function) Returns an array of elements from low to high, inclusive

range.description: (function) Returns an array of elements from low to high, inclusive

source.description: (function) returns the content of a template without rendering it

template_from_string.description: (function) loads a template from a string

twig path.description: use this snippet to get the function path from symfoy

twig encore entry link tags.description: encore_entry_link_tags for loading the css assets

twig encore entry script tags.description: encore_entry_script_tags to load the js from encore packge

twig form display.description: use this snippet to generate the form display in twig via symfony

twig form end.description: snippet to genarete form end twig

description: Makes a request to the given internal URI or controller and returns the result.
The render strategy can be specified in the strategy key of the options

function twig controller.description: Returns an instance of ControllerReference to be used with functions like render()

twig csrf_token.description: Renders a CSRF token. Use this function if you want CSRF protection in a regular HTML form not managed by the Symfony Form component.

description: Returns true if the current user has the given role.
If several roles are passed in an array, true is returned if the user has at least one of them.

twig url.description: Returns the absolute URL (with scheme and host) for the given route. If schemeRelative is enabled, it'll create a scheme-relative URL.

twig form errors.description: Renders the HTML widget of a given field. If you apply this to an entire form or collection of fields, each underlying form row will be rendered.

twig form row.description: The second argument to form_row() is an array of variables. The templates provided in Symfony only allow to override the label

twig form rest.description: This renders all fields that have not yet been rendered for the given form. It's a good idea to always have this somewhere inside your form as it'll render hidden fields for you and make any fields you forgot to render easier to spot (since it'll render the field for you).

twig function form_theme.description: Sets the resources to override the form theme for the given form view instance. You can use _self as resources to set it to the current resource.

twig function absoulute_url.description: Returns the absolute URL (with scheme and host) from the passed relative path. Combine it with the asset() function to generate absolute URLs for web assets

twig function relative_path.description: Returns the relative path from the passed absolute URL. For example, assume you're on the following page in your app: http://example.com/products/hover-board.

batch.description: filter "batches" items by returning a list of lists with the given number of items. A second parameter can be provided and used to fill in missing items

convert_encoding.description: filter converts a string from one encoding to another. The first argument is the expected output charset and the second one is the input charset

date.description: filter formats a date to a given format

date_modify.description: filter modifies a date with a given modifier string

default.description: filter returns the passed default value if the value is undefined or empty, otherwise the value of the variable

format.description: filter formats a given string by replacing the placeholders (placeholders follows the sprintf notation)

join.description: filter returns a string which is the concatenation of the items of a sequence

json_encode.description: filter returns the JSON representation of a value. Internally, Twig uses the PHP json_encode function.

merge.description: filter merges an array with another array

number_format.description: filter formats numbers. It is a wrapper around PHP's number_format function

replace.description: filter formats a given string by replacing the placeholders.

round.description: filter rounds a number to a given precision

slice.description: filter extracts a slice of a sequence, a mapping, or a string

split.description: filter splits a string by the given delimiter and returns a list of strings

trim().description: filter strips whitespace (or other characters) from the beginning and end of a string

filter humanize.description: Makes a technical name human readable (i.e. replaces underscores by spaces or transforms camelCase text like helloWorld to hello world and then capitalizes the string).

twig yaml encode.description: Transforms the input into YAML syntax.

twig yaml_dump.description: Does the same as yaml_encode(), but includes the type in the output.

twig filter abbr_class.description: Generates an <abbr> element with the short name of a PHP class (the FQCN will be shown in a tooltip when a user hovers over the element).

twig filter abbr_method.description: Generates an <abbr> element using the FQCN::method() syntax. If method is Closure, Closure will be used instead and if method doesn't have a class name, it's shown as a function (method()).

twig filter format_args.description: Generates a string with the arguments and their types (within <em> elements).

twig filter format_args_as_text.description: Equal to the format_args filter, but without using HTML tags.

end.description: The if statement in Twig is comparable with the if statements of PHP
